Reciprocate.GCMC.daily-decline-of-cordia: The daily variation of Cordiality for all NPCs. Cordiality represents the rate of reciprocating gifts.
Reciprocate.GCMC.max-cordiality.name: Max Cordiality
Reciprocate.GCMC.max-cordiality.tooltip: Cordiality represents the probability of reciprocating gifts, and when it exceeds 100, it serves as a buffer against decline.
Reciprocate.GCMC.additional-gifts-after-: The probability of NPCs giving additional gifts after reaching 8 Hearts.
Reciprocate.GCMC.cordiality-changes-love: When an NPC receives a gift with the "Love" taste, there is a change in Cordiality.
Reciprocate.GCMC.cordiality-changes-like: When an NPC receives a gift with the "Like" taste, there is a change in Cordiality.
Reciprocate.GCMC.cordiality-changes-neut: When an NPC receives a gift with the "Neutral" taste, there is a change in Cordiality.
Reciprocate.GCMC.cordiality-changes-disl: When an NPC receives a gift with the "Dislike" taste, there is a change in Cordiality.
Reciprocate.GCMC.cordiality-changes-hate: When an NPC receives a gift with the "Hate" taste, there is a change in Cordiality.
Reciprocate.GCMC.birthday-return-gift.to: The options villagers have to trigger a return gift on birthdays.
Reciprocate.GCMC.bubble-display.name: Dialogue bubble
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:0: $hThanks for thinking of me! Here's a little something in return.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:1: $hHang on, I’ve got something for you too.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:2: $hHold on, this is just a little something to give back.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:3: $h@, here’s a gift for you—hope you like it!
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:4: $h@, I’ve got something handy you might like.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:5: $h@, I’m sure you’ll enjoy this too!
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:7: $hWould you like this as well? I’d be thrilled if you took it.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:8: $hI think you’ll like this as well!
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:9: $hHere’s something nice, hope you’ll take it!
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Default:10: $hThis is great too, you’ll want to take it!
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Alex.174:0: $hYou need to supplement protein as well.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Alex.174:1: $hThis is a little token of appreciation, and it's helpful for your muscles.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Elliott:0: $hOf course, it’s my turn to give something back.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Elliott:1: $hAh! I just remembered I had this for you.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Elliott.392:: $hCan you feel it? The smell of the sea.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Harvey:1: $hEating this is good for your body.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Sam:0: $hHey, did you know? I also have something I want to give you.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Sam:1: $lUm... I just wanted to say... you should also like this.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Sebastian:0: $hSo... I guess I should give you something back, right?
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Sebastian:1: $lIf this isn’t your thing, let me know, alright?
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Shane:0: $hWhat? You expecting something back? Here, take it.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Shane:1: $lYou’re relentless. Didn’t think you’d want something back so badly.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Abigail:0: $hOh, @! I’ve got something for you too!
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Abigail:1: $lI’m really happy, but I need to show you some love too.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Emily:0: $hOkay, I’ve been shown so much kindness—it’s my turn to give back!
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Emily:1: $l@, I hope you’ll like this as well.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Haley:0: $hMaybe today’s the day I give you something in return.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Haley:1: $l@, make sure to take care of this after you get it, okay?
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Leah.613:0: $hMy eyes are good at spotting wild fruits. @, take it.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Leah.634:0: $hMy eyes are good at spotting wild fruits. @, take it.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Leah.638:0: $hMy eyes are good at spotting wild fruits. @, take it.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Leah.636:0: $hMy eyes are good at spotting wild fruits. @, take it.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Leah.637:0: $hMy eyes are good at spotting wild fruits. @, take it.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Leah.635:0: $hMy eyes are good at spotting wild fruits. @, take it.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Leah:0: $hAwesome! I’ve got something for you in return.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Leah:1: $l@, I love swapping gifts like this.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Maru:0: $hOh, @! Do you think you’ll like this?
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Maru:1: $lHmm, yeah. My gift’s pretty good too, right?
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Penny.612:0: $hDon't tell the children I gave you this.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Penny.731:0: $hDon't tell the children I gave you this.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Penny:0: $hThat’s right! I should give you something as well.
Reciprocate.Dialogue.Giving.Penny:1: $lSo... Do you think you’ll like this?
Reciprocate.Bubble.NoReciprocate.Like:0: That was a really nice gift...
Reciprocate.Bubble.NoReciprocate.Like:1: I should probably give something back, huh?
Reciprocate.Bubble.NoReciprocate.Like:7: What can I do to repay {p}?
Reciprocate.Bubble.NoReciprocate.Like:8: How can I thank {p} for this?
Reciprocate.Bubble.NoReciprocate.Dislike: I’m not sure what to do with this.
{p} must be playing a prank, right?
What am I supposed to do with this?
That's a little too much, don’t you think?
Sorry, I’m just not a fan of {i}.
Wow, {p}'s got quite the sense of humor!
Reciprocate.Bubble.Reciprocate:6: Thanks, this will definitely come in handy!
Reciprocate.Bubble.Reciprocate:7: Here, I’ve got something for you.
Reciprocate.Bubble.Reciprocate:9: I hope you see the beauty in {i} too.
Reciprocate.Mail.Respond:0: I got a gift in return so quickly, it was awesome!
